title: Will NASA astronauts switch from Boeing to SpaceX for their return to Earth by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA officially announces or it is widely reported by at least three major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or Space.com) that astronauts who initially flew to the International Space Station on a Boeing capsule have switched to a SpaceX vehicle for their return to Earth. The astronauts in question do not need to be specifically named Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams. The question will resolve as NO if the astronauts return using a Boeing vehicle, any other means, or if no such switch is announced or reported by the specified date.

The announcement should specifically mention the change in transportation provider for these named astronauts. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if NASA confirms that Boeing will be used for their return, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement must be made through official NASA channels or be reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, or BBC). The question resolves as NO if NASA does not make such an announcement, or if they confirm that the astronauts will return in the same Boeing capsule they used for their journey to the ISS. title: Will any Egyptian airline report an incident related to Iranian airspace by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, any Egyptian airline officially reports an incident directly related to Iranian airspace. An 'incident' in this context refers to any noteworthy event affecting flight operations, such as unexpected route changes, delays, or safety concerns. The incident must be confirmed by either:

1. An official statement from the airline itself, or
2. Reports from at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).

The incident must be specifically related to Iranian airspace, whether it involves entering, avoiding, or navigating near it. Routine flight path adjustments or scheduled changes do not qualify as incidents for this question.

If no such incident is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Iran issue an airspace warning due to military exercises by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Iran issues an official warning for airlines to avoid its airspace due to military exercises. The warning must meet the following criteria:

1. It must be an official statement from the Iranian government or a relevant Iranian authority.
2. The warning must specifically instruct airlines to avoid Iranian airspace.
3. The reason for the warning must be explicitly stated as military exercises.
4. The warning must be confirmed by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera, or similar).

The question will resolve as NO if no such warning meeting all the above criteria is issued by the specified date. Warnings issued for reasons other than military exercises, or warnings that do not specifically instruct airlines to avoid Iranian airspace, will not qualify for a YES resolution.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tesla has completed a remote software upgrade for more than 1.5 million vehicles in China to address a safety feature related to trunk locking. The upgrade must be specifically aimed at ensuring the vehicles warn drivers when the trunk is not properly locked. Confirmation of completion must come from official Tesla announcements, statements from Chinese regulatory bodies, or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). The upgrade must be fully implemented, not just announced or partially rolled out. If the upgrade is not confirmed as completed for the specified number of vehicles by the given date, or if the scope of the upgrade is significantly reduced, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will any Turkish airline report an incident related to Iranian airspace by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, any Turkish airline officially reports an incident directly related to Iranian airspace. The incident must be specifically related to Iranian airspace, whether it involves entering, avoiding, or navigating near it. Routine flight path adjustments or scheduled changes do not qualify as incidents for this question.

If no such incident is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the WHO convene an expert group to assess the dengue outbreak in Southeast Asia by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially convenes an expert group to assess whether the dengue outbreak in Southeast Asia warrants being declared a global emergency. The convening of this expert group must be confirmed by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) or through official WHO communications. The mere discussion or planning of such a group does not qualify for a YES resolution; the expert group must be formally assembled. If no such expert group is convened by the specified date, or if the WHO explicitly states it will not convene such a group for this purpose, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Tesla complete a major software upgrade for over 1.5 million vehicles in the United States by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tesla has completed a remote software upgrade for more than 1.5 million vehicles in the United States to address a safety feature related to trunk locking. The upgrade must be specifically aimed at ensuring the vehicles warn drivers when the trunk is not properly locked. Confirmation of completion must come from official Tesla announcements, statements from US regulatory bodies, or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). The upgrade must be fully implemented, not just announced or partially rolled out. If the upgrade is not confirmed as completed for the specified number of vehicles by the given date, or if the scope of the upgrade is significantly reduced, the question resolves as NO.
